column1: #Text=There is a difference between Europe's and Canada's position re Syrian refugees.
#Text=Europe is easy to get to and millions have arrived in Europe with next to zero screening or vetting.
#Text=Europe has adopted a humanitarian response born out of necessity.
#Text=Canada, on the other hand, selects refugees, after weeks of interviews and examinations, based on whether or not they can be an economic asset to Canada.
#Text=There is not much humanitarian about Canada's policy re Syria refugees, which is basically an extension of its immigration policy, as far as I can tell.
#Text=Canada is picking the 'good' ones and leaving the 'bad' ones for Europe.
#Text=And Canada is simply not taking it's fair share.
#Text=Germany took 40 times more refugees than Canada last year.
#Text=All the rich European countries have taken more than Canada.
#Text=Considering USA is largely to blame for the Syrian disaster, I think USA should take at least 3 million refugees.
